Igrani film: Roko i Cicibela [95 minuta, scenarij: Miljenko Smoje, reÃƒâ€¦Ã‚Â¾ija: Stipe DeliÃƒâ€žÃ¢â‚¬Â¡, Hrvatska, 1978.]

English description:

Based on real characters, the film "Roko and Cicibela" is a document of the collective memory of peoples and anarchist history, saved and written by Miljenko Smoje (late croatian writer). The film takes place in Split, where extremely poor Roko and Cicibela live and despite the fact that they do not know how to read or write, they know what it means to be poor and that it's injustice that has to be changed. "Rasps, bomb, revolver! Long live holly anarchy!" - loud slogans come from taverns and MatejuÃƒâ€¦Ã‚Â¡ka (old Split port) where they lived in rotten boat (gajeta, type of the boat).
